com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
Interface SecureCreditCard

All Known Subinterfaces:
ManualEntryCardData
public interface SecureCreditCard

Sets of card data that move in/out of the SDK must implement this interface. The PeripheralsManager will send up an object that implements SecureCreditCard when it detects a card swipe. Also, when taking a payment you can supply an object that implements SecureCreditCard (like the domain.ManualEntryCardData object, the SecureCreditCard object that PeripheralsManager emitted during a swipe, or your own credit card object that implements SecureCreditCard).

Nested Class Summary
static class SecureCreditCard.EncryptionMode
          The type of encryption on this secure credit card.

Method Detail

getCardHoldersName

String getCardHoldersName()
The card holder's name.

Returns:
A String containing the card holder's name.

getLastFourDigits

String getLastFourDigits()
The last 4 digits of the credit card. For some cards, that is the only portion of the number that is available, for other cards (like manual entry credit cards) the entire number may be known.

Returns:
A string containing the last 4 digits.

getCVVNumber

String getCVVNumber()
The CVV number of the credit card if known.

Returns:
A string containing the CVV number. Null if the CVV is not known.

getExpiryDate

String getExpiryDate()
The expiry date of the credit card. The format of the string is as follows: "092019" represents September of the year 2019.

Returns:
A string containing the expiry date of the credit card.

getEncryptionMode

SecureCreditCard.EncryptionMode getEncryptionMode()
The encryption mode of this card.

Returns:
An EncryptionMode enum value.

getUnencryptedCardNo

String getUnencryptedCardNo()
The full unencrypted card number. For some cards this value is not obtainable and may be null.

Returns:
Null if the data is not available, otherwise it's a string containing the card number.

getSecureData

org.json.JSONObject getSecureData()
Returns the JSON formatted secure data of the credit card.

Returns:
A JSONObject containing the secure credit card data. Please see additional documentation for the JSON format that is needed by the backend system.

copy

SecureCreditCard copy()
